name: scale-x-scale-x-n
desc: The "scale-x":{} objects are used to manipulate and style the x axis.  It is also possible to add additional x-axes by including objects such as "scale-x-2":{}, "scale-x-3":{}, etc.

attrs.name: item(Object)
attrs.desc: Including the "item":{} object within "scale-x":{} allows you to manipulate and style to x axis values

attrs.name: alpha
attrs.desc: Sets the text's transparency of the scale-x (The horizontal line at the bottom of the chart).

attrs.name: angle
attrs.desc: Sets the rotation angle of the scale-x.

attrs.name: decimals
attrs.desc: Sets the number of decimals which will be displayed as scale-x values.  Note this attribute does round the values to fit within the define number of decimals.

attrs.name: decimals-separatordecimalsSeparator
attrs.desc: Sets the separator to be used in place of the default decimal point.  Any string or character can be used to replace the decimal.

attrs.name: exponent
attrs.desc: Sets whether the scale values will be displayed in exponential notation.  Particularly useful when dealing with large numbers.

attrs.name: exponent-decimalsexponentDecimals
attrs.desc: Sets the number of decimals that will be displayed when using exponential notation.  This allows scale values to be more precise.

attrs.name: format
attrs.desc: Allows you to set the format for the scale-x values.

attrs.name: guide
attrs.desc: Including the "guide":{} object within the "scale-x:{} object allows you to control the lines perpendicular to the x-axis which create the grid in the background. You can use attributes within the "guide:{ } object to change the look of the lines.

attrs.name: items-overlapitemsOverlap
attrs.desc: Setting the items-overlap attribute to true forces all scale x items to show

attrs.name: label
attrs.desc: Including the "label":{ } object within "scale-x":{ } allows you to add a label to the x axis.  You can then add attributes within the "label":{ } object to manipulate and style to label.

attrs.name: labels
attrs.desc: Allows you to set custom labels that correspond to each of the ticks on a scale.  If there are more ticks than labels, the default values will be used for the remaining labels.

attrs.name: line-colorlineColor
attrs.desc: Sets the line color of the object, applicable on non-closed shapes. See also border-color for closed shapes.

attrs.name: line-gap-sizelineGapSize
attrs.desc: Sets the gap size in case of a non-contiguous line style.

attrs.name: line-segment-sizelineSegmentSize
attrs.desc: Sets the segment size in case of a non-contiguous line style.

attrs.name: line-stylelineStyle
attrs.desc: Sets the style applied to lines and borders of the object.

attrs.name: line-widthlineWidth
attrs.desc: Sets the line width of the object, applicable on non-closed shapes. See also border-width for closed shapes.

attrs.name: margin
attrs.desc: Sets the object's margin/s.

attrs.name: margin-bottommarginBottom
attrs.desc: Sets the object's bottom margin.

attrs.name: margin-leftmarginLeft
attrs.desc: Sets the object's left margin.

attrs.name: margin-rightmarginRight
attrs.desc: Sets the object's right margin.

attrs.name: margin-topmarginTop
attrs.desc: Sets the object's top margin.

attrs.name: markers
attrs.desc: Including the markers object within scale x will allow you to create both "type":"area" and "type":"line" markers which run perpendicular to the x axis.

attrs.name: max-itemsmaxItems
attrs.desc: Sets the max number of values displaying along the bottom horizontal line.

attrs.name: max-labelsmaxLabels
attrs.desc: Sets the maximum number of labels that will display along the axis.

attrs.name: max-ticksmaxTicks
attrs.desc: Sets the maximum number of ticks to display on the x axis.

attrs.name: max-valuemaxValue
attrs.desc: Sets the maximum value for the x axis. "max-value": is one of the multiple ways you can set x axis values.  Commonly used with time series data.  Also see "mix-value": and "step":

attrs.name: min-valueminValue
attrs.desc: Sets the minimum value for the x axis. "min-value": is one of the multiple ways you can set x axis values.  Commonly used with time series data.  Also see "max-value": and "step":

attrs.name: minor-guideminorGuide
attrs.desc: Including the "minor-guide":{} object will allow you to create and style gridlines on "minor-ticks".  Note you must also include the necessary objects and attributes to include minor ticks.

attrs.name: minor-tickminorTick
attrs.desc: Including the "minor-tick":{} object within "scale-x":{} will allow you to manipulate/style minor ticks.  Note the "minor-ticks": attribute must be used to set the number of minor ticks.

attrs.name: minor-ticksminorTicks
attrs.desc: Sets the number of "minor-ticks": which will be place between each tick.

attrs.name: mirrored
attrs.desc: Setting "mirrored":true will reverse/mirror the x axis values.  "scale-x":{} values will read right to left.

attrs.name: multiplier
attrs.desc: Setting "multiplier":true will abbreviate long numbers as small digits with a short unit indicator such as K, M, B NOTE: you can also use the attribute "short":true

attrs.name: negation
attrs.desc: Sets the negative symbol just outside of the formatted value.

attrs.name: offset
attrs.desc: Sets an offset on both sides of the plotted data.  This will cause the data to appear as if it were "squeezed" together.

attrs.name: offset-endoffsetEnd
attrs.desc: Sets an offset from the end of the plotted data.  This will cause the data to appear as if it were "squeezed" from the right side.

attrs.name: offset-startoffsetStart
attrs.desc: Sets an offset at the start of the plotted data.  This will cause the data to appear as if it were "squeezed" from the left side.

attrs.name: offset-xoffsetX
attrs.desc: Sets an x offset that will be applied to the scale-x object.

attrs.name: offset-yoffsetY
attrs.desc: Sets a y offset that will be applied to the scale-x object.

attrs.name: ref-linerefLine
attrs.desc: The "ref-line":{} object is used to create reference lines that appear behind the chart data.  This can be used to highlight specific information or to direct attention to certain areas of your chart.

attrs.name: rules
attrs.desc: Rules allows you to include logic within your JSON code to apply sets of attributes to certain aspects of your chart that meet a specified requirement.  See rules for usage information.

attrs.name: short
attrs.desc: Setting to true will cause the values on the x axis to use an abbreviated notation with a short unit such as K,M,B, etc.

attrs.name: short-unitshortUnit
attrs.desc: Specifies which unit of measure to use when short is set to true.

attrs.name: size
attrs.desc: Sets the size of the object/shape.

attrs.name: size-factor
attrs.desc: Auto size-factor automatically scales a pie chart to allow all value-box objects to appear without clipping.

attrs.name: step
attrs.desc: The "step": attribute sets the value of each step along an axis.  When using numeric values along the axis, a numeric value for "step": will incrementally increase the value of each tick along the axis by the specified step value.When the transform attribute is set to "type":"date", a number of different step values can then be used to modify the step increments. See transform for more information on how to implement various date and time formats.

attrs.name: thousands-separatorthousandsSeparator
attrs.desc: Inserts punctuation to separate numbers in values over 999.

attrs.name: tick
attrs.desc: Including the "tick":{} object within "scale-x":{} allows you to manipulate and style the ticks along the x axis.

attrs.name: transform
attrs.desc: Allows the underlying data to be 'transformed' to a new format if it was in that format originally. For example, if data is coded as a date and time, and 'type':'date' is specified as an attribute of this object, '1311261385209' will display 'Wed, 19 of May 05:00 PM' if '%D, %d %M %h:%i %A' is specified under the transform attribute of scale-x. See demo.

attrs.name: values
attrs.desc: The "values": attribute allows you to set the scale for the x axis.  This can be done in a few different ways.  You can use an array of integers. You can set a min and max value.  You can set a min value max value and step. You can also create a sting of values.  Note you can also use "mix-value": "max-value": and "step": attributes to set the scale of the x-axis.

attrs.name: visible
attrs.desc: You can set the "scale-x":{ } to "visible":false to hide the x axis.  The x-axis will still calculate plots correctly, however you will not be able to see the x axis line or any of the attributes such as scale values.  If you simply want to hide the x axis line you can utilize "line-color":"none".  This will remove the visibility of the x axis line and still allow you to style ticks, items, etc separately,

attrs.name: zoom-snapzoomSnap
attrs.desc: When zooming is enabled, setting zoom-snap to true snaps the zoom area to the nearest data node as a zoom area is selected.  By default, zoom-snap is set to false.

attrs.name: zoom-tozoomTo
attrs.desc: Sets the scale-x values that the chart will zoom to by default on chart render. Note the "preview":{} object or the "scroll-x":{} object are recommended to provide users with a way to view the rest of the chart data.

attrs.name: zoom-to-valueszoomToValues
attrs.desc: Sets the scale-x values that the chart will zoom to by default on chart render when "scale-x":{} "values":["",""] are defined as a string. Note the "preview":{ } object or the "scroll-x":{} object are recommended to provide users with a way to view the rest of the chart data.

attrs.name: zooming
attrs.desc: Allows users to zoom parallel to the x axis of the chart. Click and drag on the chart to select zoom area.  Can be use with "scale-y":{} zooming to allow users horizontal and vertical zooming abilities.
